metadata.Title: CVE-2014-1522 on Ubuntu 14.04 ESM (trusty) - medium.
metadata.Description:
The mozilla::dom::OscillatorNodeEngine::ComputeCustom function in the Web Audio subsystem in Mozilla Firefox before 29.0 and SeaMonkey before 2.26 allows remote attackers to execute arbitrary code or cause a denial of service (out-of-bounds read, memory corruption, and application crash) via crafted content.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2014-1522` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

firefox - 29.0+build1-0ubuntu0.14.04.2
firefox-globalmenu - 29.0+build1-0ubuntu0.14.04.2
firefox-mozsymbols - 29.0+build1-0ubuntu0.14.04.2
firefox-testsuite - 29.0+build1-0ubuntu0.14.04.2
No subscription required

criterions.comment: firefox package in trusty was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '29.0+build1-0ubuntu0.14.04.2').
